data:
<edited_content>
# Frequently Asked Questions About Tuition & Enrollment

## Introduction

Starting your educational journey with Excel High School comes with many questions about tuition, enrollment processes, and program options. This guide covers the most frequently asked questions to help you navigate these important aspects of your education. Understanding these key points will help you make informed decisions about your academic path.

## Top Five Tuition & Enrollment FAQs

### 1. Will colleges accept my Excel High School credits and diploma?

Yes! Excel High School is nationally accredited by Cognia and the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools (MSA-CESS), which are recognized accrediting organizations. This accreditation ensures that colleges, universities, employers, and the military recognize and accept our diplomas and transcripts. Excel High School graduates have been accepted to hundreds of colleges and universities across the country.

While most institutions accept our credits, it's a good idea to contact your specific colleges of interest to confirm their credit acceptance policies, as admission requirements can vary.

### 2. Can I change programs after I've enrolled?

Absolutely. Educational needs often change over time. You can upgrade or change your program at any point during your enrollment. For example, if you want to switch from a single course to a full diploma program, or change between diploma tracks, you can simply contact our Student Services team.

The tuition you've already paid will be applied toward your new program, and you'll only need to pay the difference if upgrading. Program changes typically take 1-2 business days to process, so you can continue learning with minimal interruption.

### 3. What payment options are available for tuition?

Excel High School offers several flexible payment options:
- Full payment: Pay the entire tuition upfront and receive a discount
- Monthly payment plans: Spread your tuition over affordable monthly installments
- Quarterly payment plans: Make payments every three months
- Third-party financing: Options available through partner financial institutions
- Discounts: Military, sibling, and financial need-based options may be available

We accept all major credit cards, PayPal, and electronic checks. There are no hidden fees, and all course materials are included in your tuition.

### 4. How long will it take to complete my program?

Program completion time varies based on several factors:
- Full diploma programs: Typically 1-2 years, depending on transfer credits and your pace
- Individual courses: Can be completed in as little as 4-8 weeks or extended up to 12 months
- Credit recovery: Often completed within 4-8 weeks per course

The self-paced learning model means you can move quickly through material you understand well or take more time with challenging concepts. There are no set semester dates or deadlines, allowing you to create a schedule that works for your personal situation.

### 5. What if I need to take a break from my studies?

Sometimes life circumstances require flexibility in your studies. Excel High School offers:
- Course extensions: Add 3, 6, or 12 months to your enrollment period
- Temporary holds: Pause your studies for up to 3-6 months due to personal circumstances, medical issues, or other important life events
- Re-enrollment options: If your enrollment expires, you can re-enroll and keep your academic progress

During a temporary hold, your account stays active, but the course completion timeline is paused. To request any of these options, contact Student Services before your enrollment period ends.

## Quick Links

[<button>Tuition Page</button>](https://www.excelhighschool.com/tuition) - View detailed program costs and payment options

[<button>Help Desk</button>](https://www.excelhighschool.com/help) - Submit specific questions to our support team

[<button>Payment Portal</button>](https://www.excelhighschool.com/payments) - Make payments, view payment history, and update payment methods

Still have questions? Our Student Services team is available Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Central Time. You can reach us by phone at (800) 620-3844 or email at support@excelhighschool.com.
</edited_content>

<edit_summary>
- Simplified some complex language and sentence structures to make the content more accessible to high school students (ages 14-18)
- Removed self-referential language like "we've compiled" and replaced with more direct statements
- Shortened some longer sentences to improve readability for diverse academic backgrounds
- Replaced some advanced vocabulary with more straightforward alternatives (e.g., "disruption" → "interruption", "empowering" → "help")
- Maintained all essential information while making the tone more approachable for teenage learners in an asynchronous environment
</edit_summary>
